page.description: Use the HTTP method POST to retrieve the specified URL
page.syntax: Page_Text as C = http_post_page2(C url [,B post_body [,L include_headers [,N timeout ]]])

argument.name: Page_Text
argument.description: The HTML text of the selected page. Null if the server cannot be contacted.

argument.name: url
argument.description: The address of the server that will receive your data.

argument.name: post_body
argument.description: Optional. Default = " ". The parameters you wish to send. The size of this field is unlimited.

argument.name: include_headers
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .F. (do not return headers). Allows the programmer to have the function return the headers along with the response body.

argument.name: timeout
argument.description: Numeric. Optional. Default = . Specifies the time, in seconds, after which the function should time out if a complete response has not been received from the server.

page.discussion:
The HTTP_POST_PAGE2() function extends the HTTP_POST Function to support XML transfers. The HTTP_POST() function downloads from URL using HTTP/1.1 POST. Note : HTTP_POST_PAGE2() uses a Microsoft component named IXMLHTTPRequest. If the certificate does not match, the object aborts the connection.
HTTP_POST_PAGE2() is not server-safe and cannot be used in an A5W environment.
